item.title: Windows Media Player Crashes On Startup, No Error Message
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
except in windows 7 it’s just a shortcut to the same player, runs exactly the same way

on XP and Vista it just launches the win98 media player

if WMP broke, you might as well switch to MPC-HC, it has the same skin as mplayer2 on XP +[/size] you can freely resize the screen with the numpad (EVEN IN FULLSCREEN)

item.title: Windows Media Player Crashes On Startup, No Error Message
item.dc:creator: Tei
item.description:
mankyman6:

I like how everyone automatically recommends something else for him. He’s a big boy, I’m sure he knows there are plenty of alternatives.

He obviously wants someone to help him fix WMP, not recommend something new…

This annoys the shit out of me. Whenever i bring up questions regarding drawing programs like MSPaint, everybody just tells me to use Photoshop instead. News Flash! : i USE PHOTOSHOP! STFU AND ANSWER MY QUESTiON!!

For the record, i actually gave good advice in this thread but it kinda got buried. WMP Classic (mplayer2) is the same program without all the extra stuff. it’s like safemode for WMP but still completely functional.

-Kawai Tei-

item.source: Windows Media Player Crashes On Startup, No Error Message

item.title: Windows Media Player Crashes On Startup, No Error Message
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
For a real answer (though using other players is a good idea):

Directly after WMP crashes, go into Control Panel (Start orb > Control Panel), then go into Administrative Tools (if in Category view, change “View by” to “Large icons”).

Go into Event Viewer (might take a few moments to load) and go into Windows Logs. Go through the logs listed inside that folder and find the error that WMP gives, then search the Internets for a solution.

That’s what I’d do.

Then search the Internets for a better player.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows Media Player Crashes On Startup, No Error Message

sersoft:

I see they finally updated the damn thing. Last time I checked it was still linking to a 2010 build.

I’m using K-Lite, since it works as well (for me anyway) and is updated more often.

item.source: Windows Media Player Crashes On Startup, No Error Message

item.title: Windows Media Player Crashes On Startup, No Error Message
item.dc:creator: Tei
item.description:
First of all, use the RUN prompt to start “mplayer2”. if it runs, you have an Explorer bug. if not, then it’s a DLL issue. “mplayer2” is the basic WMP without all the bells and whistles. WMP is built ontop of Explorer. What you have is likely a compatibility issue with WMP and some other Explorer app you have running either intentionally or hidden in the background. if you just want a basic media player, just use WMP Classic. You don’t have to download anything because it’s already on your system. Plus it does everything that WMP does without the headaches and extra BS that WMP does.

You can even set it to run as your default media player.

-Kawai Tei-

Read full topic
